### Description

__Description:*
When a user selects the _From Date_ and _To Date_ in the _Cash Receipt Report_ screen and clicks the _Print_ button, a _400 Bad Request error_ appears in the network console. However, the report is still downloaded successfully. This error may indicate an _incorrect API request_ or _unnecessary validation issues_.
__Preconditions:*
* The user is logged into the ERP system.
_ The _Cash Receipt Report* module is accessible.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance Module > Reports > Cash Receipt Report_.
- Select a valid _From Date_ and _To Date_ in the date filters.
- Click the _Print_ button.
- Observe the network logs in the browser's developer console (_F12 > Network tab_).
__Expected Result:*
_ The _report should be printed/downloaded successfully_ without any _error messages*.
_ No _400 status code* should be logged in the network console.

__Suggested Fix:*
_ Investigate _why the request is returning a 400 error* even though the report is being downloaded.
_ Ensure that the _API request for printing_ is correctly formatted and _does not contain invalid parameters*.

Title: (SP24) @General: Search Functionality Not Working in Advanced Search (Select Account Dialog) Across All ERP System Modules (Add/Edit Screens)
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Search Functionality Fails in the Advanced Search Dialog for Selecting an Account Across Multiple ERP Modules
__Description:*
In multiple modules of the ERP system, including _Treasury Definition, Bank Definition, Payment In, and Payment Out_, the _Advanced Search (Select Account)_ dialog does not filter results when the user enters a search term. This issue prevents users from efficiently finding and selecting an account, leading to delays and poor user experience.
__Affected Modules:*
* Treasury Definition Add/Edit
* Bank Definition Add/Edit
* Payment In Add/Edit
* Payment Out Add/Edit
__Preconditions:*
* The user is logged into the ERP system with appropriate access to the affected modules.
* The system contains existing accounts available for selection.
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to any of the affected modules (e.g., _Treasury Definition Add/Edit_).
- Click on the _Select Account_ field to open the _Advanced Search Dialog_.
- In the search input field, type an account name or account code.
- Observe that no filtering or search results appear based on the entered query.
__Expected Result:*
* As the user types in the search field, the system should dynamically filter and display relevant account results.
_ The search should support filtering based on _account name_ or _account code*.
_ If no results match the search term, an appropriate _"No results found"* message should be displayed.
__Actual Result:*
* The search input does not trigger any filtering of the account list.
* The full list of accounts remains unchanged, even when entering a search term.
* Users are unable to efficiently locate specific accounts, leading to a poor user experience.
__Suggested Fix:*
* Ensure that the search input field triggers a request to filter the accounts dynamically.
_ Validate whether _API requests* for search functionality are being made correctly.
_ Implement _debouncing* to prevent excessive search requests.
_ Ensure that the search function considers both _account name_ and _account code*.
* Display an appropriate message when no matching results are found.
__Severity:*
_High_ ? The inability to search for accounts across multiple modules significantly impacts user workflow and system efficiency.

Title: (SP24): Non-descriptive error message displayed in a pop-up when selecting a Bank account with an invalid payment method.
Description:
### Description
__Title:*
Non-descriptive error message displayed in a pop-up when selecting a Bank account with an invalid payment method.
----
__Description:*
When a user selects a _Bank account_ that has a payment method other than _Transfer_ (e.g., Visa or Span) in the _Fund Transfer Add_ screen, a non-descriptive error message is displayed in a pop-up at the bottom layer. The message reads:
_"Error you can't select bank without payment method."_
This message is not informative, does not guide the user to resolve the issue, and appears in an incorrect view (pop-up at the bottom layer). According to the business rules, only Bank accounts with the _Transfer_ payment method should be selectable for Fund Transfers.
----
__Precondition:*
- The user is logged in with the necessary permissions.
- The _Fund Transfer Add_ screen is accessible.
- At least one Bank account exists in the system with a payment method other than _Transfer_ (e.g., Visa or Span).
----
__Steps to Reproduce:*
- Navigate to _Finance Module > Transaction Submenu > Fund Transfer_.
- Click on the _Add_ button to open the Fund Transfer Add screen.
- In the _Send From_ section:
-_ Select _Bank_ in the _Payment Hub* field.
-_ In the _Payment Hub Details_ field, select a Bank account that has a payment method other than _Transfer* (e.g., Visa or Span).
- Observe the system behavior.
----
__Expected Result:*
_ The system should display a _clear and informative error message_ in the correct view (e.g., near the _Payment Hub Details* field or in a modal dialog).
_ The error message should guide the user to select a Bank account with the _Transfer* payment method.
* Example of an informative message:
_"Invalid Payment Method: Please select a Bank account with the 'Transfer' payment method."_
----
__Actual Result:*
* A non-descriptive error message is displayed in a pop-up at the bottom layer:
_"Error you can't select bank without payment method."_
* The message does not specify the issue or guide the user to resolve it.
* The pop-up appears in an incorrect view (bottom layer), making it less noticeable.
----
__Impact:*
* Users are confused by the non-descriptive error message and may not understand how to resolve the issue.
* The incorrect placement of the pop-up (bottom layer) makes it easy to miss, leading to frustration and delays in completing the transaction.
* This issue affects the user experience and may result in incorrect data entry or abandoned transactions.
----
__Severity:*
_Medium_ ? This is a usability issue that impacts the user experience but does not prevent the core functionality from working.
----
__Priority:*
_High_ ? The error message needs to be improved to ensure users can complete their tasks efficiently.
----
__Attachments:*
- Screenshot of the non-descriptive error message in the pop-up.
- Screenshot of the Fund Transfer Add screen with the selected Bank account.
- Logs or additional error details from the system.
----
__Root Cause Analysis (If Available):*
The issue occurs because:
- The system allows the selection of Bank accounts with payment methods other than _Transfer_, even though the business rules specify that only _Transfer_ is acceptable.
- The error message is hardcoded and does not provide sufficient context or guidance.
- The pop-up is displayed in an incorrect view (bottom layer), making it less noticeable and user-friendly.
----
__Suggested Fix:*
- _Validation Rule:_
-_ Update the system to filter and display only Bank accounts with the _Transfer_ payment method in the _Payment Hub Details* dropdown.

Title: (SP21) @General: Search Functionality Sends Excessive Requests Due to Lack of Debouncing
Description:
### Description
_Title:_
Search Functionality Sends Excessive Requests Due to Lack of Debouncing
----
_Description:_
The search functionality does not efficiently handle user input, causing an excessive number of requests to be sent to the server. Each time the user types a character, a request is immediately triggered, even if the time between keystrokes is less than one second. This can lead to server overload, performance issues, and unnecessary network traffic. Implementing _debouncing_ should optimize the search behavior.
----
_Precondition:_
* The ERP system is accessible, and the user has access to the search feature.
----
_Steps to Reproduce:_
- Log in to the ERP system.
- Navigate to a screen where the search functionality is available.
- Start typing a search term letter by letter.
- Observe that each keystroke triggers a request without waiting for a pause in typing.
----
_Expected Result:_
_ The search functionality should implement _debouncing*, meaning it waits for a short delay (e.g., 500?800ms) after the user stops typing before sending a request.
* This reduces unnecessary server requests and improves performance.
----
_Actual Result:_
* A request is sent for every character typed, even if the delay between keystrokes is very short.
* This causes excessive API calls, leading to increased server load and potential performance degradation.
----
_Suggested Fix:_
_ Implement _Debouncing* in the search functionality to delay API requests until the user has stopped typing for a defined period (e.g., 500?800ms).
